text:
Strange Encounters

A dim street filled with murmurs.  
Raskolnikov stands, tension thick in the air.  
Porter: “Why are you hanging about?”  
Raskolnikov: “You funk the police station then?”  
Peasant woman: “He’s a rogue!”  

---  

Raskolnikov pushed into the street, unsteady.  
Workman: “Strange man!”  
Woman: “There are strange folks about nowadays.”  
Big porter: “Better have nothing to do with him.”  

---  

Raskolnikov hesitates at the crossroads, lost.  
Raskolnikov (thought): “Shall I go there or not?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov is confronted by suspicious townspeople who label him a rogue, prompting him to contemplate whether to go to the police station.
